conbody.p: Eucalyptus lets you generate reports to monitor cloud resource use. Each type of report is for a specified time range. Eucalyptus supports the following report types. ou can generate reports for instances, volume, elastic IP, and compute.

ul.li: Instances: Provides utilization within an instance. You may see CPU spiking, reconsider the VM type. Health of the instance and how it's being utilized. Shows a count and duration of instances running, sorted by image size, as well as I/O net and disk, during the date range specified. If desired, the report can be displayed on a per-user, per-account, per-cluster or per-availability zone basis. Once filtered, reports can be grouped using the same criteria as filters. For example, you might display the results by user, and then group the results so that they are displayed based on accounts, e.g. each user in account A is shown followed by each user in account B, etc.

li.b: Volume: Tells you how many volumes in use, the size of each, and number of days in use. Use for capacity, billing, who uses what.

ul.li: Elastic IP: Lifeccyle of EIP in your cloud. For billing by EIP. Which user is using which IPs, which are in use, how often does some allocate an IP and for how long.
Capacity: Do a cloud capacity report: how much storage, IP, etc. available to determine how many resources are available in your cloud.
S3: Same as IPs: we know when an object is created, deleted, how many objects a user has within a bucket. Empty buckets aren't reported.
Snapshots: Same as IPs: when created, deleted. Help you determine how many snapshots you have.

conbody.p: You can generate reports in either CSV or HTML formats for use with external tools.
